arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: List all environments that contain given string in their name or id.

arguments.name: --type
arguments.help: List all environments with the given type.
arguments.listOfValues: Trial, Sandbox, Production, Developer, Teams, SubscriptionBasedTrial
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: Trial, Sandbox, Production, Developer, Teams, SubscriptionBasedTrial

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: List all environments that contain given string in their name.

arguments.name: --organization-id
arguments.help: List all environments that contain given string in their organization id.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: Sets the name of the environment.

arguments.name: --region
arguments.help: Sets the environment's region name. [defaults to unitedstates]

arguments.name: --type
arguments.help: Sets the environment Type.
arguments.listOfValues: Trial, Sandbox, Production, Developer, Teams, SubscriptionBasedTrial
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: Trial, Sandbox, Production, Developer, Teams, SubscriptionBasedTrial

arguments.name: --currency
arguments.help: Sets the currency used for your environment. [defaults to USD]

arguments.name: --language
arguments.help: Sets the language used for your environment. [defaults to English]

arguments.name: --templates
arguments.help: Sets Dynamics365 app that needs to be deployed. [passed as comma separated values] e.g : -tm "D365_Sample, D365_Sales"

arguments.name: --domain
arguments.help: The domain name is part of the environment URL. If domain name is already in use, a numeric value will be appended to the domain name. Eg: If 'contoso' is already in use, then the environment URL will be updated to https://{contoso}0.crm.dynamics.com.
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], [0 - 9], or '-' are allowed. The first and last character cannot be the '-' character. Consecutive '-' characters are not allowed.

arguments.name: --input-file
arguments.help: The verb arguments to be passed in a .json input file. Eg: {"name" : "contoso"}. The arguments passed through command-line will take precedence over arguments from the .json input file.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --team-id
arguments.help: Team Id as Guid
arguments.RegexHelp: The Team Id must be a valid Guid.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that requires backup.

arguments.name: --label
arguments.help: Sets the backup label as provided.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that needs to be deleted from your tenant.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes

arguments.help: URL or ID of the Environment that needs to be reset.

arguments.name: --currency
arguments.help: Sets the currency used for your environment. [defaults to USD]

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: Sets the name of the environment.

arguments.name: --language

arguments.help: Sets the description used to associate the environment with a specific intent.

arguments.name: --input-file

arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the source environment required for restore.

arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the target environment required for restore. This would default to source URL/ID if not provided.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time

arguments.help: ID or URL of the environment to assign a user to.

arguments.help: Object ID or UPN of AAD user to be assigned to the environment or Application ID if assigning an Application User.

arguments.name: --role
arguments.help: Name or ID of security role to be applied to user

arguments.name: --application-user
arguments.help: Specifies whether the input user is an application user. If business unit is not specified the application user will be added to the authenticated users business unit.

arguments.help: ID of business unit to associate application user with.

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

arguments.help: Output directory

arguments.help: The name of the template to instantiate. Note: the template 'legacy' will be removed in a future release.

arguments.name: --package-name
arguments.help: Sets the default name of the package. Applies to the generation of ImportExtension.GetNameOfImport.

arguments.help: Indicates whether to also include some sample files for the PkgAssets/Content folder.

verbs.name: add-external-package
verbs.help: Adds a package that is external to the Dataverse solution

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to the external package

arguments.name: --package-type
arguments.help: The type of the package being added. e.g. 'xpp' for FnO packages.

arguments.name: --import-order
arguments.help: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

arguments.name: --skip-validation
arguments.help: Adds the item to the project file even if the file does not exist or appears to be invalid. Note, this will not affect any validation that is performed by MSBuild.

verbs.name: add-solution
verbs.help: Adds a prebuilt Dataverse solution file

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to the Dataverse solution file (must be *.zip)

arguments.name: --import-order
arguments.help: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

arguments.name: --skip-validation
arguments.help: Adds the item to the project file even if the file does not exist or appears to be invalid. Note, this will not affect any validation that is performed by MSBuild.

arguments.name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --import-mode
arguments.help: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution.

arguments.name: --missing-dependency-behavior
arguments.help: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment.

arguments.name: --dependency-overrides
arguments.help: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: `<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>`. Where the minVersion and maxVersion is optional but should be in .Net version format syntax.
arguments.RegexHelp: Use a semicolon delimited list of dependency overrides of the format <uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>.

arguments.name: --layer-order-behavior
arguments.help: This argument is applicable only for 1st party solutions.

arguments.name: --layer-order-solution-unique-names
arguments.help: This argument is applicable only for 1st party solutions.
arguments.RegexHelp: Use a semicolon delimited list of solution uniquenames.

arguments.help: The namespace for the component
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], [0 - 9], or '.' are allowed. The first and last character may not be the '.' character. Consecutive '.' characters are not allowed. Numbers are not allowed as the first character or immediately after a period.

arguments.help: The name for the component
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z] or [0 - 9] are allowed. The first character may not be a number.

arguments.name: --geo
arguments.help: Which geographical instance of the Power Apps Checker service to use.
arguments.listOfValues: PreviewUnitedStates, UnitedStates, Europe, Asia, Australia, Japan, India, Canada, SouthAmerica, UnitedKingdom, France, Germany, UnitedArabEmirates, Switzerland, USGovernment, USGovernmentL4, USGovernmentL5DoD, China
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: PreviewUnitedStates, UnitedStates, Europe, Asia, Australia, Japan, India, Canada, SouthAmerica, UnitedKingdom, France, Germany, UnitedArabEmirates, Switzerland, USGovernment, USGovernmentL4, USGovernmentL5DoD, China

arguments.name: --customEndpoint
arguments.help: Specify a custom URL as Power Apps Checker endpoint

arguments.name: --ruleLevelOverride
arguments.help: Path to a file containing a JSON array rules and levels to override.  Accepted values for OverrideLevel are: Critical, High, Medium, Low, Informational. Example: [{"Id":"meta-remove-dup-reg","OverrideLevel":"Medium"},{"Id":"il-avoid-specialized-update-ops","OverrideLevel":"Medium"}]

arguments.name: --ruleSet
arguments.help: Select a rule set that will be executed as part of this build. Values: A valid Guid, "AppSource Certification", "Solution Checker" (default)

arguments.name: --excludedFiles
arguments.help: Exclude Files from the Analysis. Pass as comma-separated values

verbs.name: create-settings
verbs.help: Create a settings file from solution.

arguments.name: --solution-zip
arguments.help: Path to solution zip file.

arguments.name: --solution-folder
arguments.help: Path to the local, unpacked solution folder: either the root of the 'Other/Solution.xml' file or a folder with a .cdsproj file.

arguments.name: --settings-file
arguments.help: The .json file with the deployment settings for connection references and environment variables.

verbs.name: pack
verbs.help: Package solution components on local filesystem

arguments.name: --zipfile
arguments.help: The full path to the solution ZIP file

arguments.name: --folder
arguments.help: The path to the root folder on the local filesystem. When unpacking/extractins, this will be written to, when packing this will be read from.

arguments.name: --packagetype
arguments.help: When unpacking/extracting, use to specify dual Managed and Unmanaged operation. When packing, use to specify Managed or Unmanaged from a previous unpack 'Both'. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'; default: 'Unmanaged'

arguments.name: --log
arguments.help: The path to the log file.

arguments.name: --errorlevel
arguments.help: Minimum logging level for log output [Verbose|Info|Warning|Error|Off]; default: Info

arguments.name: --singleComponent
arguments.help: Only perform action on a single component type [WebResource|Plugin|Workflow|None]; default: None.

arguments.name: --allowDelete
arguments.help: Dictates if delete operations may occur; default: false.

arguments.name: --allowWrite
arguments.help: Dictates if write operations may occur; default: false.

arguments.name: --clobber
arguments.help: Enables that files marked read-only can be deleted or overwritten; default: false.

arguments.name: --map
arguments.help: The full path to a mapping xml file from which to read component folders to pack.

arguments.name: --sourceLoc
arguments.help: Generates a template resource file. Valid only on Extract. Possible Values are auto or an LCID/ISO code of the language you wish to export. When Present, this will extract the string resources from the given locale as a neutral .resx. If auto or just the long or short form of the switch is specified the base locale for the solution will be used.

arguments.name: --localize
arguments.help: Extract or merge all string resources into .resx files.

arguments.name: --useLcid
arguments.help: Use LCID's (1033) rather than ISO codes (en-US) for language files.

arguments.name: --useUnmanagedFileForMissingManaged
arguments.help: Use the same XML source file when packaging for Managed and only Unmanaged XML file is found; applies to AppModuleSiteMap, AppModuleMap, FormXml files

arguments.name: --disablePluginRemap
arguments.help: Disabled plug-in fully qualified type name remapping. default: false

arguments.name: --processCanvasApps
arguments.help: Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. default: false

verbs.name: add-solution-component
verbs.help: Adds a solution component to the target solution

arguments.name: --solutionUniqueName
arguments.help: Name of the solution

arguments.name: --component
arguments.help: The schema name or ID of the component to add to the target solution

arguments.name: --componentType
arguments.help: The value that represents the solution component that you are adding

arguments.name: --AddRequiredComponents
arguments.help: Indicates whether other solution components that are required by the solution component that you are adding should also be added to the unmanaged solution

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: Environment URL or ID of the target environment.

verbs.name: sync
verbs.help: Sync the current solution to the current state of the solution

arguments.name: --solution-folder
arguments.help: Path to the local, unpacked solution folder: either the root of the 'Other/Solution.xml' file or a folder with a .cdsproj file.

arguments.name: --include
arguments.help: Which settings should be included in the solution being exported
arguments.listOfValues: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales
arguments.listOfDisplayValues: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales

arguments.name: --async
arguments.help: Exports solution asynchronously

arguments.name: --max-async-wait-time
arguments.help: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes

arguments.name: --processCanvasApps
arguments.help: Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. default: false

arguments.name: --packagetype
arguments.help: When unpacking/extracting, use to specify dual Managed and Unmanaged operation. When packing, use to specify Managed or Unmanaged from a previous unpack 'Both'. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'; default: 'Unmanaged'

verbs.name: disable
verbs.help: Choose to not send usage information

verbs.name: status
verbs.help: Show the current status of telemetry

commands.help: Tools that can be installed and launched

arguments.help: Update tool to latest available version from nuget.org

arguments.name: --clear
arguments.help: Clear tool from local file cache
